intro: Koeleria andreanszkyi, commonly known as the Andrássy's koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are usually pale blue or purple, adding a subtle beauty to its natural habitat. Koeleria andreanszkyi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
